properties.areaDesc: Ventura County Coast; Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles
properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 3 at 4:28PM PST until February 4 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves of 4 to 6 feet
are expected due to elevated surf through late tonight. The
highest waves will be on exposed west facing beaches.

* WHERE...Ventura County Coast, Los Angeles County Coast and
Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands.

* WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip
currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can
wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats
nearshore.
properties.instruction:
Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or
stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly
in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST TUESDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IS CANCELLED
